feels.name: Trust
feels.quote: Dorothea had been safe at Freshitt Hall nearly a week before she had asked any dangerous questions.

feels.name: Surprise
feels.quote: It seemed a long while—she did not know how long—before she heard Celia saying, 'That will do, nurse; he will be quiet on my lap now.'

feels.name: Anger
feels.quote: The blood rushed to Dorothea’s face and neck painfully.

feels.name: Joy
feels.quote: Dorothea sank back in her chair when her uncle had left the room, and cast her eyes down meditatively on her crossed hands.

feels.name: Sadness
feels.quote: Then, with an effort to recall subjects not connected with her agitation, she added, abruptly, 'You know every one in Middlemarch, I think, Mr. Lydgate.'

Places.name: Freshitt_Hall
Places.description: Dorothea felt safe and happy at Freshitt Hall.

Places.name: Dorothea_s_sitting_room
Places.description: Celia's statement surprised Dorothea in her sitting room.

Places.description: Dorothea felt anger in her sitting room.

Places.name: Dorothea_s_sitting_room
Places.description: Dorothea felt joy after her uncle left the room.

Places.description: Dorothea felt sadness in her sitting room.

Events.description: Dorothea felt safe and asked questions at Freshitt Hall.

Events.name: Dorothea_s_emotional_turmoil
Events.description: Dorothea's emotional turmoil caused her sadness.
